Single Instance Configuration Document Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain the Instance Configuration Document for the Single Root Edit Primitive Instance.
Parameters Launch Agent 1 Core The parameters of the Root Edit Primitive are fully specified by the Operational Process Definition in Operational Process Definition.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 1 Agent Artifact. Information on Launch Agent 1 governance that is unrelated to the use of the Root Edit Primitive is located at Governance Information Unrelated To Root Edit Primitive .
Routine Protocol Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 1 Agent Artifact in routine or normal conditions (i.e., non-emergency situations).
Root Edit Proposal Submission Launch Agent 1 Core The Root Edit process begins with a AGENT1 token holder submitting a proposal through the Powerhouse system containing a draft Artifact Edit Proposal. A AGENT1 token holder must hold at least 1% of the circulating token supply to submit a proposal. The proposal must also be posted on the Sky Forum under the "Launch Agent 1" tag.
Root Edit Proposal Submission Requirements Exception Launch Agent 1 Core For proposals that solely entail a buyback or a grant of AGENT1 tokens, the requirement that AGENT1 token holders must hold at least 1% of the circulating token supply to submit a proposal is waived. However, all other procedural requirements within the Root Edit process continue to apply.
Root Edit Expert Advisor Review Launch Agent 1 Core A future iteration of the Launch Agent 1 Artifact will specify guidelines for obtaining specialized review of proposals requiring advanced technical or financial analysis.
Root Edit Proposal Review By Operational Facilitator Launch Agent 1 Core Within seven (7) days of the proposal being submitted, the Operational Facilitator must review the Root Edit Proposal for alignment.If the proposal is aligned, the Operational Facilitator must respond to the Forum post to announce their finding. In this Forum post, the Operational Facilitator must also confirm that the proposal is feasible for Operational GovOps to operationalize.If the proposal is misaligned, the Operational Facilitator must respond to the Forum post to announce their finding and provide the reasoning for it.
Root Edit Token Holder Vote Launch Agent 1 Core Where their review of the proposal results in a finding of alignment with the Sky Core Atlas and Launch Agent 1 Artifact, the Operational Facilitator next triggers a Snapshot poll to allow token holders to vote on the proposal. The poll is open for three (3) days. A poll must have at least 10% of the circulating token supply participating and must have 50% of votes in favor to be approved.
Root Edit Artifact Update Launch Agent 1 Core At the conclusion of the poll, if the proposal is approved, the Operational Facilitator submits the edit to Powerhouse to formally update the Agent Artifact. Regardless of the outcome, the Operational Facilitator updates the Powerhouse System to include the result of the vote, including any pertinent documents.
Artifact Edit Restrictions Launch Agent 1 Core The Launch Agent 1 Artifact cannot be edited in any way that violates the Sky Core Atlas or its specifications of the Sky Primitives, or in any way that is otherwise misaligned. The Operational Facilitator must enforce this rule through their review of Artifact Edit Proposals.
Non-Routine Protocol Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 1 Agent Artifact in non-routine conditions.
Emergency Protocol Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 1 Agent Artifact in urgent or emergency situations.
Root Edit Voting Process in Urgent and Emergency Situations Launch Agent 1 Core In an Urgent or Emergency Situation, as defined by the Sky Core Atlas in A.1.8 - Emergency Voting System - Definition Of Emergency Situations, the Operational Facilitator may allow a Root Edit to occur more quickly than the timeline specified above. Where feasible, the Operational Facilitator should announce the decision to deploy the emergency Root Edit protocol and provide their reasoning via a public Sky Forum post (under the "Launch Agent 1" tag), unless doing so would endanger Launch Agent 1 or its users.
Data Repository Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain data relevant to the Single Instance of the Root Edit Primitive.
Initial Planning Launch Agent 1 Core The materials associated with initial planning of the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Operational GovOps Review Launch Agent 1 Core The materials associated with Operational GovOps Review during the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Artifact Edit Proposal Launch Agent 1 Core The materials associated with preparing the Artifact Edit Proposal during the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Completed Instances Launch Agent 1 Core The Instances of the Root Edit Primitive with Completed Status are contained herein.
In Progress Invocations Launch Agent 1 Core Because the Root Edit Primitive is deployed only once, no further Instances of the Primitive can be Invoked.

Upkeep Rebate Primitive Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain all data and specifications for Launch Agent 1's Instance of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive. See .

Active Instances Directory Launch Agent 1 Core This document contains a Directory of all Instances of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive with Instance status of Active.

Hub Data Repository Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain the Data Repository for the Primitive Hub Document.
Archived Invocations/Instances Launch Agent 1 Core The subtrees for archived Invocations and Instances of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive are stored here.
Failed Invocations Launch Agent 1 Core The subtrees for failed Invocations of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive are stored here.

Active Instances Launch Agent 1 Core The Instances of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive with Active Status are stored herein.
Single Instance Configuration Document Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain the Instance Configuration Document for the Single Upkeep Rebate Primitive Instance.
Parameters Launch Agent 1 Core Every Star Agent is entitled to the Upkeep Rebate Primitive for tokens of other Star Agents that they hold. Because this right automatically applies, there are no parameters.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the process for the ongoing management of the Single Instance of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Routine Protocol Launch Agent 1 Core This document defines the protocol for routine ongoing management of the Single Instance of this Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Launch Agent 1 Holds Tokens Of Other Agents In Its SubProxy Account Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 keeps all tokens of other Agents it holds in its SubProxy account.
Launch Agent 1 Deducts Rebate From Ecosystem Upkeep Fees Launch Agent 1 Core When paying Ecosystem Upkeep fees, Launch Agent 1 deducts the rebate from the fees it pays.
Operational GovOps Reviews Rebate Launch Agent 1 Core Operational GovOps reviews Launch Agent 1's calculation of the rebate before executing a return of surplus to token holders. In the event of any issues, Operational GovOps cannot execute the distribution. If Operational GovOps does not execute the distribution, Operational GovOps must post an explanation on the Sky Forum under the "Launch Agent 1" tag and work with Launch Agent 1 to resolve the disagreement. If Operational GovOps and Launch Agent 1 cannot resolve the disagreement, it must be escalated to Core GovOps.
Non-Routine Protocol Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the protocol for non-routine ongoing management of the Single Instance of this Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Emergency Protocol Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the protocol for handling emergency situations in the ongoing management of the Single Instance of this Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Data Repository Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain data relevant to the Single Instance of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Initial Planning Launch Agent 1 Core The materials associated with initial planning of the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Operational GovOps Review Launch Agent 1 Core The materials associated with Operational GovOps Review during the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Artifact Edit Proposal Launch Agent 1 Core The materials associated with preparing the Artifact Edit Proposal during the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Completed Instances Launch Agent 1 Core The Instances of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive with Completed Status are contained herein.
In Progress Invocations Launch Agent 1 Core Because the Upkeep Rebate Primitive is deployed only once, no further Instances of the Primitive can be Invoked.

Omni Documents Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define Launch Agent 1's strategic intent and operational processes relating to infrastructure inherited from Sky Core, activities unrelated to Sky Primitives, or activities spanning multiple Sky Primitives.
Governance Information Unrelated To Root Edit Primitive Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein specify Launch Agent 1 governance information that is unrelated to the use of the Root Edit Primitive. The governance process for updating the Launch Agent 1 Artifact is specified in the Root Edit Primitive above at Root Edit Primitive .
Sky Forum Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 uses the Sky Forum for governance-related discussion. Posts should use the "Launch Agent 1" tag.
Sky Ecosystem Emergency Response Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein specify Launch Agent 1's emergency response protocol in situations that impact the entire Sky Ecosystem. This protocol will be specified in a future iteration of the Launch Agent 1 Artifact.
Agent-Specific Emergency Response Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein specify Launch Agent 1's emergency response protocol in situations solely impacting Launch Agent 1 versus the broader Sky Ecosystem. This protocol will be specified in a future iteration of the Launch Agent 1 Artifact.
Strategic Intent Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1's initial priority is to deploy a RWA Allocation Conduit, following which it will deploy crypto-native Conduits for Morpho and Curve.
RWA Conduit Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 will begin with onboarding winners of the Grand Prix (https://forum.sky.money/t/announcement-spark-tokenization-grand-prix-request-for-proposal/24631) and will expand to additional partners shortly thereafter.
Crypto-Native Conduits Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 will deploy Allocation Conduits for Morpho and Curve to capture high-yield, low-risk DeFi opportunities.
Morpho Allocation Conduit Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 will allocate capital to low risk collateral to take advantage of opportunities for high rates in these markets.
Curve Allocation Conduit Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 will partner with emerging stablecoins to deploy liquidity against fiat-backed stablecoins.
Projected Operational Roadmap Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1's phased plan to execute its strategy includes:1) Deploy infrastructure to enable initial allocation conduits;2) Establish manual reallocation processes; and 3) Develop quantitative reallocation parameters and conditions to optimize and decentralize conduit management over time.
Management Of Infrastructure Inherited From Sky Core Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein specify Launch Agent 1's strategy and operational processes for managing infrastructure inherited from Sky Core.
Andromeda Launch Agent 1 Core Control of the Andromeda RWA Arranged Structure is currently being transitioned to Launch Agent 1. Andromeda is the RWA Arranged Structure inherited from Sky Core that allocates capital into safe, short-term treasury strategies of less than one (1) year duration.
Parameters Launch Agent 1 Core The parameters of Andromeda are defined in .
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the process for the ongoing management of Andromeda. Future iterations of the Artifact will specify operational processes owned by Launch Agent 1.
Data Repository Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain data relevant to Andromeda.
Lite Peg Stability Module Launch Agent 1 Core Control of the Lite PSM is currently being transitioned to Launch Agent 1.
Parameters Launch Agent 1 Core The parameters of the Lite PSM are defined in the Sky Core Atlas.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the process for the ongoing management of the Lite PSM. Future iterations of the Artifact will specify operational processes owned by Launch Agent 1.
Parameter Modification Launch Agent 1 Core Sky Core Facilitators currently own the process for modifying the parameters of the Lite PSM, which process is defined in the Sky Core Atlas. This process is currently being transitioned over to Launch Agent 1.
Data Repository Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain data relevant to the Lite PSM.
Exploratory Allocation Opportunities Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 will consider allocations to basis trades, pendle PTs, and other delta-neutral crypto primitives.
Launch Agent 2 Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein specify all of the logic for Launch Agent 2, including Launch Agent 2's strategy and how it uses the Sky Primitives to operationalize this strategy.
Introduction Launch Agent 2 Core Launch Agent 2 is an Agent dedicated to expanding access to USDS, sUSDS, and other Sky benefits with an initial focus on the Solana ecosystem. Launch Agent 2 leverages strategic incentives and partnerships to foster adoption, deliver the Sky Savings Rate, and bring USDS liquidity to new markets. Launch Agent 2 also identifies and executes allocation opportunities to generate excess returns on assets in Sky's collateral portfolio. Launch Agent 2 plans to develop a user-facing DeFi hub as well as other products that align naturally with Launch Agent 2's existing capabilities, including borrowing and lending solutions.

Token Emissions Launch Agent 2 Core Token emissions beyond the Genesis Supply are permanently disabled; this cannot be reverted by Launch Agent 2 Governance. Sky Governance retains the ability to revert where Launch Agent 2 is in violation of First Loss Capital requirements and emissions are required by the Risk Framework. See A.3.3.

Single Instance Configuration Document Location Launch Agent 2 Core This Instance's associated Instance Configuration Document is located at Single Instance Configuration Document.
Completed Instances Directory Launch Agent 2 Core This document contains a Directory of all Instances of the Root Edit Primitive with Instance status of Completed.
In Progress Invocations Directory Launch Agent 2 Core Because the Root Edit Primitive is deployed only once, no further Instances of the Primitive can be Invoked.
Hub Data Repository Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein contain the Data Repository for the Primitive Hub Document.
Archived Invocations/Instances Launch Agent 2 Core The subtrees for archived Invocations and Instances of the Root Edit Primitive are stored here.
Failed Invocations Launch Agent 2 Core The subtrees for failed Invocations of the Root Edit Primitive are stored here.
Suspended Instances Launch Agent 2 Core The subtrees for Instances of the Root Edit Primitive with Suspended Status are stored here.
Active Instances Launch Agent 2 Core The Instances of the Root Edit Primitive with Active Status are stored herein.
Single Instance Configuration Document Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein contain the Instance Configuration Document for the Single Root Edit Primitive Instance.
Parameters Launch Agent 2 Core The parameters of the Root Edit Primitive are fully specified by the Operational Process Definition in Operational Process Definition.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 2 Agent Artifact. Information on Launch Agent 2 governance that is unrelated to the use of the Root Edit Primitive is located at Governance Information Unrelated To Root Edit Primitive.
Routine Protocol Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 2 Agent Artifact in routine or normal conditions (i.e., non-emergency situations).
Root Edit Proposal Submission Launch Agent 2 Core The Root Edit process begins with a AGENT2 token holder submitting a proposal through the Powerhouse system containing a draft Artifact Edit Proposal. A AGENT2 token holder must hold at least 1% of the circulating token supply to submit a proposal. The proposal must also be posted on the Sky Forum under the "Launch Agent 2" tag.
Root Edit Proposal Submission Requirements Exception Launch Agent 2 Core For proposals that solely entail a buyback or a grant of AGENT2 tokens, the requirement that AGENT2 token holders must hold at least 1% of the circulating token supply to submit a proposal is waived. However, all other procedural requirements within the Root Edit process continue to apply.
Root Edit Expert Advisor Review Launch Agent 2 Core A future iteration of the Launch Agent 2 Artifact will specify guidelines for obtaining specialized review of proposals requiring advanced technical or financial analysis.
Root Edit Proposal Review By Operational Facilitator Launch Agent 2 Core Within seven (7) days of the proposal being submitted, the Operational Facilitator must review the Root Edit Proposal for alignment.If the proposal is aligned, the Operational Facilitator must respond to the Forum post to announce their finding. In this Forum post, the Operational Facilitator must also confirm that the proposal is feasible for Operational GovOps to operationalize.If the proposal is misaligned, the Operational Facilitator must respond to the Forum post to announce their finding and provide the reasoning for it.
Root Edit Token Holder Vote Launch Agent 2 Core Where their review of the proposal results in a finding of alignment with the Sky Core Atlas and Launch Agent 2 Artifact, the Operational Facilitator next triggers a Snapshot poll to allow token holders to vote on the proposal. The poll is open for three (3) days. A poll must have at least 10% of the circulating token supply participating and must have 50% of votes in favor to be approved.
Root Edit Artifact Update Launch Agent 2 Core At the conclusion of the poll, if the proposal is approved, the Operational Facilitator submits the edit to Powerhouse to formally update the Agent Artifact. Regardless of the outcome, the Operational Facilitator updates the Powerhouse System to include the result of the vote, including any pertinent documents.
Artifact Edit Restrictions Launch Agent 2 Core The Launch Agent 2 Artifact cannot be edited in any way that violates the Sky Core Atlas or its specifications of the Sky Primitives, or in any way that is otherwise misaligned. The Operational Facilitator must enforce this rule through their review of Artifact Edit Proposals.
Non-Routine Protocol Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 2 Agent Artifact in non-routine conditions.
Emergency Protocol Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 2 Agent Artifact in urgent or emergency situations.
Root Edit Voting Process in Urgent and Emergency Situations Launch Agent 2 Core In an Urgent or Emergency Situation, as defined by the Sky Core Atlas in A.1.8 - Emergency Voting System - Definition Of Emergency Situations, the Operational Facilitator may allow a Root Edit to occur more quickly than the timeline specified above. Where feasible, the Operational Facilitator should announce the decision to deploy the emergency Root Edit protocol and provide their reasoning via a public Sky Forum post (under the "Launch Agent 2" tag), unless doing so would endanger Launch Agent 2 or its users.
Data Repository Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein contain data relevant to the Single Instance of the Root Edit Primitive.
Initial Planning Launch Agent 2 Core The materials associated with initial planning of the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Operational GovOps Review Launch Agent 2 Core The materials associated with Operational GovOps Review during the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Artifact Edit Proposal Launch Agent 2 Core The materials associated with preparing the Artifact Edit Proposal during the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Completed Instances Launch Agent 2 Core The Instances of the Root Edit Primitive with Completed Status are contained herein.
In Progress Invocations Launch Agent 2 Core Because the Root Edit Primitive is deployed only once, no further Instances of the Primitive can be Invoked.

Invocations that are completed successfully are moved to Active Instances, whereas failed Invocations are Archived in Hub Data Repository.

Terms Launch Agent 2 Core Launch Agent 2 will buy back and distribute 0.25% of its total token supply per year.

Upkeep Rebate Primitive Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein contain all data and specifications for Launch Agent 2's Instance of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive. See .

Active Instances Directory Launch Agent 2 Core This document contains a Directory of all Instances of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive with Instance status of Active.

Archived Invocations/Instances Launch Agent 2 Core The subtrees for archived Invocations and Instances of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive are stored here.
Failed Invocations Launch Agent 2 Core The subtrees for failed Invocations of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive are stored here.

Active Instances Launch Agent 2 Core The Instances of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive with Active Status are stored herein.
Single Instance Configuration Document Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein contain the Instance Configuration Document for the Single Upkeep Rebate Primitive Instance.
Parameters Launch Agent 2 Core Every Star Agent is entitled to the Upkeep Rebate Primitive for tokens of other Star Agents that they hold. Because this right automatically applies, there are no parameters.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the process for the ongoing management of the Single Instance of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Routine Protocol Launch Agent 2 Core This document defines the protocol for routine ongoing management of the Single Instance of this Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Launch Agent 2 Holds Tokens Of Other Agents In Its SubProxy Account Launch Agent 2 Core Launch Agent 2 keeps all tokens of other Agents it holds in its SubProxy account.
Launch Agent 2 Deducts Rebate From Ecosystem Upkeep Fees Launch Agent 2 Core When paying Ecosystem Upkeep fees, Launch Agent 2 deducts the rebate from the fees it pays.
Operational GovOps Reviews Rebate Launch Agent 2 Core Operational GovOps reviews Launch Agent 2's calculation of the rebate before executing a return of surplus to token holders. In the event of any issues, Operational GovOps cannot execute the distribution. If Operational GovOps does not execute the distribution, Operational GovOps must post an explanation on the Sky Forum under the "Launch Agent 2" tag and work with Launch Agent 2 to resolve the disagreement. If Operational GovOps and Launch Agent 2 cannot resolve the disagreement, it must be escalated to Core GovOps.
Non-Routine Protocol Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the protocol for non-routine ongoing management of the Single Instance of this Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Emergency Protocol Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the protocol for handling emergency situations in the ongoing management of the Single Instance of this Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Data Repository Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein contain data relevant to the Single Instance of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive.

Kamino Instance Configuration Document Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein contain the Instance Configuration Document for the Kamino Integration Boost Primitive Instance.
Parameters Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the parameters of the Kamino Instance of the Integration Boost Primitive.
Integration Partner Name Launch Agent 2 Core The partner for the Kamino Integration Boost is Kamino.
Integration Partner Reward Address Launch Agent 2 Core The reward address for the Kamino Integration Boost is AU4GkzA4G9rRX3hS8QCNTiVGAtt5MNUAfK5L5Q57BAC4 on Solana.
Integration Partner Chain Launch Agent 2 Core The Kamino Integration Boost is on Solana blockchain.
Integration Boost Cadence Launch Agent 2 Core The payment cadence for the Kamino Integration Boost is weekly.
Integration Boost Data Submission Format Launch Agent 2 Core The Data Submission Responsible Actor calculates the net deposits based on on-chain events and makes the data available through an API endpoint located at https://info-sky.blockanalitica.com/api/v1/solana-incentives/.
Integration Boost Data Submission Responsible Actor Launch Agent 2 Core The Data Submission Responsible Actor is BA Labs.
Integration Boost Savings Rate Adjustment Strategy Launch Agent 2 Core The Integration Boost is calculated based on per block values for USDS in Kamino and the Sky Savings Rate.
Custom Instance Parameters Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the custom parameters of the Kamino Instance of the Integration Boost Primitive, if any.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the process for the ongoing management of the Kamino Instance of the Integration Boost Primitive.
Routine Protocol Launch Agent 2 Core This document defines the protocol for routine ongoing management of the Kamino Instance. This Instance inherits the base class of operational logic defined in , subject to the qualifications specified in . Modifications to the base operational logic automatically propagate to this Instance. In future iterations of the Launch Agent 2 Artifact, a version of the full process definition customized to Launch Agent 2 will be included herein.
Agent Customizations Launch Agent 2 Core The Launch Agent 2 Agent may define Instance-specific customization of the routine protocol to extend the baseline functionality defined in the Sky Core Atlas. This can include custom routines or processes layered on top of the inherited Sky Core logic. Any extensions must remain fully aligned with the requirements specified in the Sky Core Atlas. This document defines those customizations, if any.[No customization presently.]
Non-Routine Protocol Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the protocol for non-routine ongoing management of the Kamino Instance of this Integration Boost Primitive.
Emergency Protocol Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the protocol for handling emergency situations in the ongoing management of the Kamino Instance of this Integration Boost Primitive.
Data Repository Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein contain data relevant to the Kamino Instance of the Integration Boost Primitive.
Initial Planning Launch Agent 2 Core The materials associated with initial planning of the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Operational GovOps Review Launch Agent 2 Core The materials associated with Operational GovOps Review during the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Artifact Edit Proposal Launch Agent 2 Core The materials associated with preparing the Artifact Edit Proposal during the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Integration Boost Payments Launch Agent 2 Active Data Controller The Integration Boost payments for the Kamino Instance of the Integration Boost Primitive are defined as Active Data. The Active Data is updated as follows:- The Responsible Party is Operational GovOps. - The Update Process must follow the protocol for 'Direct Edit'.

Integration Boost Data Submission Format Launch Agent 2 Core The Data Submission Responsible Actor calculates the net deposits based on on-chain events and makes the data available through an API endpoint located at https://info-sky.blockanalitica.com/api/v1/solana-incentives/. The data for Save is available through the API endpoint under Solend, the previous name Save operated under.
Integration Boost Data Submission Responsible Actor Launch Agent 2 Core The Data Submission Responsible Actor is BA Labs.
Integration Boost Savings Rate Adjustment Strategy Launch Agent 2 Core The Integration Boost is calculated based on per block values for USDS in Save and the Sky Savings Rate.

Integration Boost Cadence Launch Agent 2 Core The payment cadence for the Lifnity Integration Boost is weekly.
Integration Boost Data Submission Format Launch Agent 2 Core The Data Submission Responsible Actor calculates the net deposits based on on-chain events and makes the data available through an API endpoint located at https://info-sky.blockanalitica.com/api/v1/solana-incentives/.
Integration Boost Data Submission Responsible Actor Launch Agent 2 Core The Data Submission Responsible Actor is BA Labs.
Integration Boost Savings Rate Adjustment Strategy Launch Agent 2 Core The Integration Boost is calculated based on per block values for USDS in Lifinity and the Sky Savings Rate.
Custom Instance Parameters Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the custom parameters of the Lifinity Instance of the Integration Boost Primitive, if any.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the process for the ongoing management of the Lifinity Instance of the Integration Boost Primitive.
Routine Protocol Launch Agent 2 Core This document defines the protocol for routine ongoing management of the Lifinity Instance. This Instance inherits the base class of operational logic defined in , subject to the qualifications specified in . Modifications to the base operational logic automatically propagate to this Instance. In future iterations of the Launch Agent 2 Artifact, a version of the full process definition customized to Launch Agent 2 will be included herein.
Agent Customizations Launch Agent 2 Core The Launch Agent 2 Agent may define Instance-specific customization of the routine protocol to extend the baseline functionality defined in the Sky Core Atlas. This can include custom routines or processes layered on top of the inherited Sky Core logic. Any extensions must remain fully aligned with the requirements specified in the Sky Core Atlas. This document defines those customizations, if any.[No customization presently.]

Omni Documents Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define Launch Agent 2's strategic intent and operational processes relating to infrastructure inherited from Sky Core, activities unrelated to Sky Primitives, or activities spanning multiple Sky Primitives.

The governance process for updating the Launch Agent 2 Artifact is specified in the Root Edit Primitive above at Root Edit Primitive.
Sky Forum Launch Agent 2 Core Launch Agent 2 uses the Sky Forum for governance-related discussion. Posts should use the "Launch Agent 2" tag.
Sky Ecosystem Emergency Response Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein specify Launch Agent 2's emergency response protocol in situations that impact the entire Sky Ecosystem. This protocol will be specified in a future iteration of the Launch Agent 2 Artifact.
Agent-Specific Emergency Response Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein specify Launch Agent 2's emergency response protocol in situations solely impacting Launch Agent 2 versus the broader Sky Ecosystem. This protocol will be specified in a future iteration of the Launch Agent 2 Artifact.
Launch Agent 3 Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein specify all of the logic for Launch Agent 3, including Launch Agent 3's strategy and how it uses the Sky Primitives to operationalize this strategy.
Introduction Launch Agent 3 Core Launch Agent 3 is an Agent specializing in creating accessible and user-friendly DeFi interfaces. It operates the Launch Agent 3 Frontend user interface.Launch Agent 3 Frontend is a non-custodial web application serving as a gateway to the Sky Protocol. Through its AI-powered interface, Launch Agent 3 Frontend makes digital asset interactions intuitive and accessible for users of all experience levels-all while ensuring users maintain complete control of their assets. Launch Agent 3 Frontend never takes custody of users' private keys or assets; users retain full responsibility for managing their private keys and digital wallet access.

Token Emissions Launch Agent 3 Core Token emissions beyond the Genesis Supply are permanently disabled; this cannot be reverted by Launch Agent 3 Governance. Sky Governance retains the ability to revert where Launch Agent 3 is in violation of First Loss Capital requirements and emissions are required by the Risk Framework. See A.3.3.

Completed Instances Directory Launch Agent 3 Core This document contains a Directory of all Instances of the Root Edit Primitive with Instance status of Completed.
In Progress Invocations Directory Launch Agent 3 Core Because the Root Edit Primitive is deployed only once, no further Instances of the Primitive can be Invoked.
Hub Data Repository Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein contain the Data Repository for the Primitive Hub Document.
Archived Invocations/Instances Launch Agent 3 Core The subtrees for archived Invocations and Instances of the Root Edit Primitive are stored here.
Failed Invocations Launch Agent 3 Core The subtrees for failed Invocations of the Root Edit Primitive are stored here.
Suspended Instances Launch Agent 3 Core The subtrees for Instances of the Root Edit Primitive with Suspended Status are stored here.
Active Instances Launch Agent 3 Core The Instances of the Root Edit Primitive with Active Status are stored herein.
Single Instance Configuration Document Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein contain the Instance Configuration Document for the Single Root Edit Primitive Instance.
Parameters Launch Agent 3 Core The parameters of the Root Edit Primitive are fully specified by the Operational Process Definition in Operational Process Definition.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 3 Agent Artifact. Information on Launch Agent 3 governance that is unrelated to the use of the Root Edit Primitive is located at Governance Information Unrelated To Root Edit Primitive.
Routine Protocol Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 3 Agent Artifact in routine or normal conditions (i.e., non-emergency situations).
Root Edit Proposal Submission Launch Agent 3 Core The Root Edit process begins with a AGENT3 token holder submitting a proposal through the Powerhouse system containing a draft Artifact Edit Proposal. A AGENT3 token holder must hold at least 1% of the circulating token supply to submit a proposal. The proposal must also be posted on the Sky Forum under the "Launch Agent 3" tag.
Root Edit Proposal Submission Requirements Exception Launch Agent 3 Core For proposals that solely entail a buyback or a grant of AGENT3 tokens, the requirement that AGENT3 token holders must hold at least 1% of the circulating token supply to submit a proposal is waived. However, all other procedural requirements within the Root Edit process continue to apply.
Root Edit Expert Advisor Review Launch Agent 3 Core A future iteration of the Launch Agent 3 Artifact will specify guidelines for obtaining specialized review of proposals requiring advanced technical or financial analysis.
Root Edit Proposal Review By Operational Facilitator Launch Agent 3 Core Within seven (7) days of the proposal being submitted, the Operational Facilitator must review the Root Edit Proposal for alignment.If the proposal is aligned, the Operational Facilitator must respond to the Forum post to announce their finding. In this Forum post, the Operational Facilitator must also confirm that the proposal is feasible for Operational GovOps to operationalize.If the proposal is misaligned, the Operational Facilitator must respond to the Forum post to announce their finding and provide the reasoning for it.
Root Edit Token Holder Vote Launch Agent 3 Core Where their review of the proposal results in a finding of alignment with the Sky Core Atlas and Launch Agent 3 Artifact, the Operational Facilitator next triggers a Snapshot poll to allow token holders to vote on the proposal. The poll is open for three (3) days. A poll must have at least 10% of the circulating token supply participating and must have 50% of votes in favor to be approved.
Root Edit Artifact Update Launch Agent 3 Core At the conclusion of the poll, if the proposal is approved, the Operational Facilitator submits the edit to Powerhouse to formally update the Agent Artifact. Regardless of the outcome, the Operational Facilitator updates the Powerhouse System to include the result of the vote, including any pertinent documents.
Artifact Edit Restrictions Launch Agent 3 Core The Launch Agent 3 Artifact cannot be edited in any way that violates the Sky Core Atlas or its specifications of the Sky Primitives, or in any way that is otherwise misaligned. The Operational Facilitator must enforce this rule through their review of Artifact Edit Proposals.
Non-Routine Protocol Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 3 Agent Artifact in non-routine conditions.
Emergency Protocol Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 3 Agent Artifact in urgent or emergency situations.
Root Edit Voting Process in Urgent and Emergency Situations Launch Agent 3 Core In an Urgent or Emergency Situation, as defined by the Sky Core Atlas in A.1.8 - Emergency Voting System - Definition Of Emergency Situations, the Operational Facilitator may allow a Root Edit to occur more quickly than the timeline specified above. Where feasible, the Operational Facilitator should announce the decision to deploy the emergency Root Edit protocol and provide their reasoning via a public Sky Forum post (under the "Launch Agent 3" tag), unless doing so would endanger Launch Agent 3 or its users.
Data Repository Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein contain data relevant to the Single Instance of the Root Edit Primitive.
Initial Planning Launch Agent 3 Core The materials associated with initial planning of the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Operational GovOps Review Launch Agent 3 Core The materials associated with Operational GovOps Review during the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Artifact Edit Proposal Launch Agent 3 Core The materials associated with preparing the Artifact Edit Proposal during the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Completed Instances Launch Agent 3 Core The Instances of the Root Edit Primitive with Completed Status are contained herein.
In Progress Invocations Launch Agent 3 Core Because the Root Edit Primitive is deployed only once, no further Instances of the Primitive can be Invoked.

Terms Launch Agent 3 Core Launch Agent 3 will buy back and distribute 0.25% of its total token supply per year.

Upkeep Rebate Primitive Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein contain all data and specifications for Launch Agent 3's instance of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive. See .

Archived Invocations/Instances Launch Agent 3 Core The subtrees for archived Invocations and Instances of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive are stored here.

Single Instance Configuration Document Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein contain the Instance Configuration Document for the Single Upkeep Rebate Primitive Instance.
Parameters Launch Agent 3 Core Every Star Agent is entitled to the Upkeep Rebate Primitive for tokens of other Star Agents that they hold. Because this right automatically applies, there are no parameters.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the process for the ongoing management of the Single Instance of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Routine Protocol Launch Agent 3 Core This document defines the protocol for routine ongoing management of the Single Instance of this Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Launch Agent 3 Holds Tokens Of Other Agents In Its SubProxy Account Launch Agent 3 Core Launch Agent 3 keeps all tokens of other Agents it holds in its SubProxy account.
Launch Agent 3 Deducts Rebate From Ecosystem Upkeep Fees Launch Agent 3 Core When paying Ecosystem Upkeep fees, Launch Agent 3 deducts the rebate from the fees it pays.
Operational GovOps Reviews Rebate Launch Agent 3 Core Operational GovOps reviews Launch Agent 3's calculation of the rebate before executing a return of surplus to token holders. In the event of any issues, Operational GovOps cannot execute the distribution. If Operational GovOps does not execute the distribution, Operational GovOps must post an explanation on the Sky Forum under the "Launch Agent 3" tag and work with Launch Agent 3 to resolve the disagreement. If Operational GovOps and Launch Agent 3 cannot resolve the disagreement, it must be escalated to Core GovOps.
Non-Routine Protocol Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the protocol for non-routine ongoing management of the Single Instance of this Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Emergency Protocol Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the protocol for handling emergency situations in the ongoing management of the Single Instance of this Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Data Repository Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein contain data relevant to the Single Instance of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive.

Modifications to the base operational logic automatically propagate to this Instance. Agent Customizations Launch Agent 3 Core The Star Agent may define instance-specific customization of the routine protocol to extend the baseline functionality defined in the Sky Core Atlas. This can include custom routines or processes layered on top of the inherited Sky Core logic. Any extensions must remain fully aligned with the requirements specified in the Sky Core Atlas. This document defines those customizations, if any.[No customization presently.]

CoW Swap Instance Configuration Document Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein contain the Instance Configuration Document for the CoW Swap Accessibility Reward Primitive Instance.
Parameters Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the parameters of the CoW Swap Instance of the Accessibility Reward Primitive.
Reward Code Launch Agent 3 Core 1003.
Tracking Methodology Launch Agent 3 Core This Instance uses the Tracking Methodology specified in . Specifically, on-chain Settlement Events on the CoW Swap settlement contract (https://etherscan.io/address/0x9008d19f58aabd9ed0d60971565aa8510560ab41) are checked for where they coincide perfectly with USDS deposit transactions into sUSDS.
Custom Instance Parameters Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the custom parameters of the CoW Swap Instance of the Accessibility Reward Primitive, if any.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the process for the ongoing management of the CoW Swap Instance of the Accessibility Reward Primitive.
Routine Protocol Launch Agent 3 Core This document defines the protocol for routine ongoing management of the CoW Swap Instance. This Instance inherits the base class of operational logic defined in This Instance inherits the base class of operational logic defined in , subject to the qualifications specified in .Modifications to the base operational logic automatically propagate to this Instance. In future iterations of the Launch Agent 3 Artifact, a version of the full process definition customized to Launch Agent 3 will be included herein.
Agent Customizations Launch Agent 3 Core The Star Agent may define Instance-specific customization of the routine protocol to extend the baseline functionality defined in the Sky Core Atlas. This can include custom routines or processes layered on top of the inherited Sky Core logic. Any extensions must remain fully aligned with the requirements specified in the Sky Core Atlas. This document defines those customizations, if any.[No customization presently.]

Integration Boost Primitive Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein contain all data and specifications for Launch Agent 3's Instances of the Integration Boost Primitive. See .
Primitive Hub Document Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein organize all base information relevant to Launch Agent 3's usage of the Integration Boost Primitive.
Global Activation Status Launch Agent 3 Core Active
Active Instances Directory Launch Agent 3 Core This document contains a Directory of all Instances of the Integration Boost Primitive with Instance status of Active.
Euler Instance Configuration Document Launch Agent 3 Core This Instance's associated Instance Configuration Document is located at Euler Instance Configuration Document.
Completed Instances Directory Launch Agent 3 Core This document contains a Directory of all Instances of the Integration Boost Primitive with Instance status of Completed.
In Progress Invocations Directory Launch Agent 3 Core This document contains a Directory of all prospective Instances of the Integration Boost Primitive whose Invocation is currently in progress. Invocations that are completed successfully are moved to Active Instances Directory, whereas failed Invocations are Archived in Hub Data Repository.
Compound Launch Agent 3 Core The Invocation Status and Instance Configuration Document location of this prospective Instance are specified below:Invocation Status: PlanningInstance Configuration Document Location: Compound Instance Configuration Document.
Hub Data Repository Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein contain the Data Repository for the Primitive Hub Document.
Archived Invocations/Instances Launch Agent 3 Core The subtrees for archived Invocations and Instances of the Integration Boost Primitive are stored here.
Failed Invocations Launch Agent 3 Core The subtrees for failed Invocations of the Integration Boost Primitive are stored here.
Suspended Instances Launch Agent 3 Core The subtrees for Instances of the Integration Boost Primitive with Suspended Status are stored here.
Active Instances Launch Agent 3 Core The Instances of the Integration Boost Primitive with Active Status are stored herein.
Euler Instance Configuration Document Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein contain the Instance Configuration Document for the Euler Integration Boost Primitive Instance.
Parameters Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the parameters of the Euler Instance of the Integration Boost Primitive.
Integration Partner Name Launch Agent 3 Core The partner for the Euler Integration Boost is Euler.
Integration Partner Reward Address Launch Agent 3 Core The reward address for the Euler Integration Boost is 0x33C71422B3E20ef2472Bc9aa9252220CAeAF207e on Base.
Integration Partner Chain Launch Agent 3 Core The Euler Integration Boost is on Base blockchain.
Integration Boost Cadence Launch Agent 3 Core The payment cadence for the Euler Integration Boost is weekly.
Integration Boost Data Submission Format Launch Agent 3 Core The Data Submission Responsible Actor calculates the net deposits based on on-chain events and makes the data available through an API endpoint located at https://info-sky.blockanalitica.com/api/v1/incentivized-pools/.
Integration Boost Data Submission Responsible Actor Launch Agent 3 Core The Data Submission Responsible Actor is BA Labs.
Integration Boost Savings Rate Adjustment Strategy Launch Agent 3 Core The Integration Boost is calculated based on per block values for USDS in Euler and the Sky Savings Rate.
Custom Instance Parameters Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the custom parameters of the Euler Instance of the Integration Boost Primitive, if any.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the process for the ongoing management of the Euler Instance of the Integration Boost Primitive.

Integration Partner Reward Address Launch Agent 3 Core The reward address for the Compound Integration Boost is 0xD66241b84dC4d6ccD4aA072A9da22b4B218FC1b0 on Base.
Integration Partner Chain Launch Agent 3 Core The Compound Integration Boost is on Base blockchain.
Integration Boost Cadence Launch Agent 3 Core The payment cadence for the Compound Integration Boost is weekly.
Integration Boost Data Submission Format Launch Agent 3 Core The Data Submission Responsible Actor calculates the net deposits based on on-chain events and makes the data available through an API endpoint located at https://info-sky.blockanalitica.com/api/v1/incentivized-pools/.
Integration Boost Data Submission Responsible Actor Launch Agent 3 Core The Data Submission Responsible Actor is BA Labs.
Integration Boost Savings Rate Adjustment Strategy Launch Agent 3 Core The Integration Boost is calculated based on per block values for USDS in Compound and the Sky Savings Rate.
Custom Instance Parameters Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the custom parameters of the Compound Instance of the Integration Boost Primitive, if any.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the process for the ongoing management of the Compound Instance of the Integration Boost Primitive.
Routine Protocol Launch Agent 3 Core This document defines the protocol for routine ongoing management of the Compound Instance. This Instance inherits the base class of operational logic defined in , subject to the qualifications specified in .Modifications to the base operational logic automatically propagate to this Instance. In future iterations of the Launch Agent 3 Artifact, a version of the full process definition customized to Launch Agent 3 will be included herein.
Agent Customizations Launch Agent 3 Core The Star Agent may define instance-specific customization of the routine protocol to extend the baseline functionality defined in the Sky Core Atlas. This can include custom routines or processes layered on top of the inherited Sky Core logic. Any extensions must remain fully aligned with the requirements specified in the Sky Core Atlas. This document defines those customizations, if any.[No customization presently.]
Non-Routine Protocol Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the protocol for non-routine ongoing management of the Compound Instance of this Integration Boost Primitive.
Emergency Protocol Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein define the protocol for handling emergency situations in the ongoing management of the Compound Instance of this Integration Boost Primitive.
Data Repository Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein contain data relevant to the Compound Instance of the Integration Boost Primitive.
Initial Planning Launch Agent 3 Core The materials associated with initial planning of the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Operational GovOps Review Launch Agent 3 Core The materials associated with Operational GovOps Review during the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Artifact Edit Proposal Launch Agent 3 Core The materials associated with preparing the Artifact Edit Proposal during the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Integration Boost Payments Launch Agent 3 Active Data Controller The Integration Boost payments for the Compound Instance of the Integration Boost Primitive are defined as Active Data. The Active Data is updated as follows:- The Responsible Party is Operational GovOps. - The Update Process must follow the protocol for 'Direct Edit'.

Global Activation Status Launch Agent 3 Core Inactive
Active Instances Directory Launch Agent 3 Core This document contains a Directory of all Instances of the Pioneer Chain Primitive with Instance status of Active.
Completed Instances Directory Launch Agent 3 Core This document contains a Directory of all Instances of the Pioneer Chain Primitive with Instance status of Completed.
In Progress Invocations Directory Launch Agent 3 Core This document contains a Directory of all prospective Instances of the Pioneer Chain Primitive whose Invocation is currently in progress. Invocations that are completed successfully are moved to Active Instances Directory, whereas failed Invocations are Archived in Hub Data Repository.
Hub Data Repository Launch Agent 3 Core The documents herein contain the Data Repository for the Primitive Hub Document.
Archived Invocations/Instances Launch Agent 3 Core The subtrees for archived Invocations and Instances of the Pioneer Chain Primitive are stored here.
Failed Invocations Launch Agent 3 Core The subtrees for failed Invocations of the Pioneer Chain Primitive are stored here.
Suspended Instances Launch Agent 3 Core The subtrees for Instances of the Pioneer Chain Primitive with Suspended Status are stored here.
Active Instances Launch Agent 3 Core The Instances of the Pioneer Chain Primitive with Active Status are stored herein.
Completed Instances Launch Agent 3 Core The Instances of the Pioneer Chain Primitive with Completed Status are stored herein.
In Progress Invocations Launch Agent 3 Core The in progress Invocations of the Pioneer Chain Primitive are contained herein. Once an Invocation is successfully completed, its subtree will be moved to Active Instances.
